prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top surface The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top surface. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for this coordinate system should be set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. This will position the coordinate system for the first part of the assembly. Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face, which we will refer to as face_1. On face_1, create a closed loop consisting of four lines and one arc. The lines and arc should be positioned as follows: - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point [0.75, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.375] - Arc 1: Start point [0.75, 0.375], mid point [0.5103, 0.5103], end point [0.375, 0.75] - Line 3: Start point [0.375, 0.75], end point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.75], end point [0.0, 0.0] The total length of the loop is 0.75 units, and the width of the loop is 0.375 units. The arc has a radius of approximately 0.5103 units. After creating the loop, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will reduce the size of the sketch by 25%. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.375 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top surface. The height of the prism is 0.75 units, the width is 0.375 units, and the length is 0.75 units, as specified in the description. Finally, create a new solid body using the NewBodyFeatureOperation boolean operation. This will add the first part of the CAD assembly to the final shape.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.375,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.375]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.375],"Mid Point":[0.5103,0.5103],"End Point":[0.375,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.375,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.1125, 0.0]. 2. Draw a sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw line 1. The Start Point is [0.0, 0.0] and the End Point is [0.75, 0.0]. 4. Draw line 2. The Start Point is [0.75, 0.0] and the End Point is [0.75, 0.45]. 5. Draw line 3. The Start Point is [0.75, 0.45] and the End Point is [0.0, 0.45]. 6. Draw line 4. The Start Point is [0.0, 0.45] and the End Point is [0.0, 0.0]. 7. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 8. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 9. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.1125 and the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0. Part 2: Cylindrical Hole Create a 3D model of a cylinder with a rectangular prism on top. The cylinder is slightly larger than the prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.15, 0.0, 0.15]. 2. Draw a sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw line 1. The Start Point is [0.0, 0.0] and the End Point is [0.15, 0.0]. 4. Draw line 2. The Start Point is [0.15, 0.0] and the End Point is [0.15, 0.15]. 5. Draw line 3. The Start Point is [0.15, 0.15] and the End Point is [0.0, 0.15]. 6. Draw line 4. The Start Point is [0.0, 0.15] and the End Point is [0.0, 0.0]. 7. Draw a circle on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. The Center is [0.375, 0.075] and the Radius is 0.075. 8. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.45. 9. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 10. Perform a cut operation to remove the cylindrical volume from the prism. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0 and the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.15.</description>
